title: Dark Reading
text:
Dark Reading

This website is incredibly helpful for many different reasons. First, it has up-to-date news from around the world including any current attacks and outages, a newsletter you can sign up for to stay up to date on certain topics, mobile security, tips and tricks, and so much more. It is constantly getting updated and has things like introductory learning all the way to tips on how to better implement security measures as a CISO. For that and so many more reasons  see this as a super beneficial resource.
Source: https://www.darkreading.com/

title: SIEVE and The Benefits of Open Source
text:
SIEVE and the benefits of Open-Source

SIEVE is the brainchild of computer scientists from Emory University, Carnegie Mellon University and the Pelikan Foundation. But is Co-First Authored by Yazhuo Zhang who recently accepted a postdoctoral fellowship at the Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich. SIEVE is a new way to decide what items should be tossed from a web cache. The beauty of what they have done is it is open source. So not only the scientist from these prestige universities can be the one to work on this but anyone who has an idea can have their input. I think this Is one of the most beneficial changes to computer science. The fact that more people are willing to have their work be open source so we can faster improve in this space.

title: Center for Internet Security
text:
CIS Center for Internet Security
This is a great resource for a ton of different ideas. Like current issues going on in the cyber space. Different case studies, and different ideas on ways to deal with cyber security issues. It is also a convenient place to get information on all current and past cyber incidents.
Source : https://www.cisecurity.org/

title: The Beauty of RangeForce
text:
The Beauty of RangeForce
By: Noah Gruba
RangeForce is a website with free Cyber security training. It has a ton of modules. It uses virtual machines and real-world scenarios to help get you ready for the real world. It is hands-on and helps you learn how to do things like manage malware all the way to combating modern cyber threats. All in all I have not made it through a ton of these but it does seem to be very well done and is very useful!
Source: https://www.rangeforce.com/
